intro: Kedrostis digitata, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that resemble the fingers of a hand. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Kedrostis digitata is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional African medicine for various ailments.
